resource_data.description: Here are some useful links and documents:

slidetranscripts.slidetranscript: Temple students are granted access to an abundance of useful information through the university library. In this module, we will review a few useful databases that can benefit any Temple student. These tools include Statista and My IBISWorld – industry research databases, Mergent Online – a database consisting of details on public companies, and ABI/INFORM – a collection of 1000s of business publications. This is just an introduction to a few of the many tools made available to you through the library so be sure to explore the library website for more offerings after completing this module.

Statista is a resource that gives you quantitative information about consumers and markets from over 150 different countries and 170 different industries. The database compiles statistics from corporate and government sources, and features industry reports, market analytics, and forecasts. Statista is also a useful resource for government, social science, and country-level information.

Each Statista results page, allows you to filter your results by statistics, type of report, and, where applicable, market category. You can also filter your results by region, country, and date range.

My IBISWorld is your best bet for industry information. Each in-depth industry report offers a combination of data visualizations, quantitative information, and analysis. The coverage ranges from manufacturing and consumer industries to the service sector as well as emerging industries. Within each report, you can expect to find information about the industry’s performance, leading competitors, market drivers, and an industry outlook.

This is the standard format for an industry profile in My IBISWorld. Each report contains the following information:

● An overview of the supply chain. What are some of the related industries?

● Industry at a glance – an Executive Summary

● Industry Performance (a recent history of the industry) – taxation and regulation, customers’ disposable income

● Industry Outlook – as well as the industry Life Cycle

● Products and Markets – different types of systems; sources of industry revenue

● Competitive Landscape – competitive advantages as compared to other payment methods, cost structure benchmarks,

● Operating Conditions – an assessment of different trends and factors influencing operation, such as technological (in this case, things like fuel efficiency) change and regulation

● Key Statistics

Mergent Online is a key resource for public company information. The database is comprehensive in its coverage of publicly held US and foreign companies, including over 35,000 companies listed on a variety of financial exchanges. Each company report contains financial information dating back at least 15 years. Company profiles can also include annual reports, SEC filings, competitor information, and equity pricing. Mergent also contains analyst reports through its ‘Investext’ feature.

This is the typical formatting for a company profile in Mergent Online. Here are some of the things you’ll find in a company’s profile:

● On the main “Company Details” tab, there is a business summary, current pricing information, the company’s main executives, and key financial data

● An important feature for each company profile is the ‘Company Financials’ tab; here you’ll find 15+ years of financial performance for the company in question

● You can find backfile of company reports under the ‘Annual Reports’ tab

● Under the ‘Filings’ tab, you can search Securities and Exchange Commission filings for any company that trades on a US exchange

● Other sections of a company profile in Mergent Online include competitor information, equity pricing, and news pertaining to the company you are researching

ABI/INFORM is an article aggregator database that gives you access to a variety of publications, including academic journals, trade publications, and popular magazines and newspapers. You can use ABI/INFORM to search well-known publications like the Economist and the Wall Street Journal, but you can also use the database to simply explore unfamiliar topics or keywords related to a research topic.

When doing a basic search in ABI/INFORM, you’ll often end up with a high volume of results. You can filter your results by using the menu on the left.

● The source type is one of the most important things to consider when you’re searching for articles in a database like ABI/INFORM. What type of publication are you looking for?

● You can also limit your results by date (if you want to make sure you’re only seeing current publications), subject, language, or specific publication title.
